isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Engine Systems Check

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To check engine systems for hard or no start conditions.

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

step1.para: Inspect fuel tank and lines for damage and leaks.
Check oil line from high pressure pump to oil supply manifold for oil leaks.
Inspect entire cooling system for leaks.

Check air induction system for leaks. See Air Induction System Inspection
below.
Inspect engine wiring harness for correct routing and protection against rubbing or chaffing.

note.para: The engine will not start with the IPR or CMP disconnected.

step1.para: Check sensor, relay, and control module connections. All connections must be seated, in good condition, and free of damage or corrosion.
Inspect battery cable and fuse connections for corrosion. All connections must be seated, in good condition, and free of damage or corrosion.

note.para: The ECM harness connections must be torqued to 35 in·lb (4 N·m).

step1.para: Inspect air cleaner housing for damage or distortion that could allow unfiltered air into the engine.

Inspect for end seal movement inside the housing. End seal movement is indicated if the seal contact area is polished. A polished contact area indicates that unfiltered air has passed by the filter element and into the engine.
Inspect air cleaner element for end cap dents, holes, damaged seals, and soot.
Inspect air intake hoses and clamps for tightness and positioning over sealing beads.
Inspect the chassis mounted charge air cooler and piping.
Mask the outer diameter of air cleaner element air inlet with duct tape and plug air cleaner canister drain.
Remove the air cleaner restriction indicator or tubing to the air cleaner. Install a plug to seal opening.
Find cold air discharge pipe containing a plug. Remove plug and connect a manually regulated air supply with pressure gauge.
Apply 5-8 psi of air pressure to the air induction system. A constant air supply is needed to replace air lost through opened intake valves.
Coat areas ( a through f - below) with a soap solution and check for leaks.

step2.para: Air cleaner body surface around the outlet pipe.
Air cleaner outlet pipe to air cleaner body junction.
All clamped hose and gasket connections between air cleaner outlet and intake manifold. This includes turbocharger connections.
Surface of all air induction piping and hoses between air cleaner and intake manifold.
Air compressor air inlet piping from the air cleaner tube to and including the fitting and the gasket.
Piping to the air charge cooler.

step1.para: Leakage is not permitted between air cleaner and turbocharger (suction side). If leaks are found, tighten hose clamps. If leaks continue, replace necessary parts. Retest corrected area.

note.para: Air induction leaks can indicate dirt in the engine. Dirt can cause piston rings to wear or break causing high oil consumption and excessive blue smoke and pitting or erosion of the turbocharger compressor wheel. If leaks are found, test crankcase pressure.
